passages.text: EDWARD PRING, tiventy-feven, carpentor, was brought up :on remand :at the Greenwich Police-court, charged with stealing hewellery to the value of theo, the thro- perty of Sir Robert Cunlice ee, Bart. Mr.P.. of 37 Loyndes e' street, Belgravia. Chief Inspector Phillips said there were a number of charges against the prisoner, all the rokberies alleged being under ffmilar circumstances

The prisoner was taken into custody, it appeared, on' a charge of stealing a watch, and other articles ; alue 112, from the reffdence of Miss Keene, 8 Belgrave- terrace, Lee, The prisoner called at the house and represented that he had been sont by the landlord to see to the blinds.
